contentrichtext.text: '''Ulysses''' is an [[indie rock]] [[musical band|band]] formed by [[Robert Schneider]] (lead vocalist of [[The Apples in Stereo]]) along with [[John Ferguson (musician)|John Ferguson]] and [[Ben Fulton]] in the [[spring (season)|spring]] of 2003. [[Robert Beatty]] (of [[Hair Police]]) joined later that year. They released their first album, ''[[010 (Ulysses album)|010]]'', on October 26, 2004 through [[Eenie Meenie Records]]. The album was released in mono. ==Band history== While touring Spain with The Apples in stereo, Schneider was inspired to write "Push You Away", the first song written for ''010''. Schneider began writing other songs for the album as well. Schneider's main influences for the band's songs were [[The Velvet Underground]] and [[My Bloody Valentine (band)|My Bloody Valentine]]. In [[Lexington, Kentucky]], the band formed by impulse when Schneider invited Ferguson and Fulton to organize songs for Schneider's other side project, [[Marbles (band)| Marbles]]. Schneider asked them to first play his set of 10 songs, and Ulysses was born. The band recorded the album ''010'' live in Schneider's garage studio, in mono with the drums and amplifiers situated symmetrically around a single microphone. The album was released on Eenie Meenie Records.
